meanings.definition: The quality or state of being excessive or extreme in behavior or actions.
meanings.sent1: Her immoderatenesses in spending led to financial troubles.
meanings.sent2: His immoderatenesses in eating often left him feeling unwell.
meanings.sent3: The immoderatenesses of the squirrel in collecting nuts was quite comical.
meanings.sent4: The immoderatenesses of the storm caused widespread damage.
meanings.sent5: The immoderatenesses of the child's tantrum were hard to ignore.

meanings.definition: Excessive or extreme behavior or actions.
meanings.sent1: The immoderatenesses of his anger frightened those around him.
meanings.sent2: She regretted the immoderatenesses of her outburst later.
meanings.sent3: The immoderatenesses of the dog's excitement resulted in chaos.
meanings.sent4: The immoderatenesses of the crowd's cheering filled the stadium.
meanings.sent5: The immoderatenesses of the student's enthusiasm was infectious.
